Key Match Events: Mohammad Amir picked up two wickets in his first two overs upon return.
Amir had Tim Robinson caught by Iftikhar Ahmed at short cover off the second ball he bowled.
Amir followed it up with the scalp of Dean Foxcroft, who was caught by Babar Azam in the mid-off region.
Pre-Game Insights: Mohammad Amir announced his decision to come out of retirement in March 2024, making himself available for the upcoming ICC T20 World Cup 2024 in June.
Amir had told the media ahead of the New Zealand series that this comeback was a very special moment for him, likening it to his debut series.
Others: Mohammad Amir retired from international cricket in 2020, citing mental torture from the Pakistan Cricket Board.
Amir's career had a major hurdle in 2010 when he was implicated in a spot-fixing scandal, leading to a five-year ban from all forms of cricket and a brief jail term.
Amir made his first comeback to international cricket in January 2016, showing his skills during Pakistan's ICC Champions Trophy-winning campaign in 2017.
